com.google.gcloud.storage

Class Blob

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gcloud.storage.Blob

  • public final class Blob
extends Object
    A Google cloud storage object.

    Objects of this class are immutable. Operations that modify the blob like update(com.google.gcloud.storage.BlobInfo, com.google.gcloud.storage.Storage.BlobTargetOption...) and copyTo(com.google.gcloud.storage.BlobId, com.google.gcloud.storage.Blob.BlobSourceOption...) return a new object. To get a Blob object with the most recent information use reload(com.google.gcloud.storage.Blob.BlobSourceOption...).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  Blob.BlobSourceOption
      Class for specifying blob source options when Blob methods are used.

      • get

        public static Blob get(Storage storage,
                       String bucket,
                       String blob,
                       Storage.BlobGetOption... options)
        Creates a Blob object for the provided bucket and blob names. Performs an RPC call to get the latest blob information. Returns null if the blob does not exist.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used for issuing requests
        bucket - bucket's name
        options - blob get options
        blob - blob's name
        Returns:
        the Blob object or null if not found
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • update

        public Blob update(BlobInfo blobInfo,
                   Storage.BlobTargetOption... options)
        Updates the blob's information. Bucket or blob's name cannot be changed by this method. If you want to rename the blob or move it to a different bucket use the copyTo(com.google.gcloud.storage.BlobId, com.google.gcloud.storage.Blob.BlobSourceOption...) and delete(com.google.gcloud.storage.Blob.BlobSourceOption...) operations. A new Blob object is returned. By default no checks are made on the metadata generation of the current blob. If you want to update the information only if the current blob metadata are at their latest version use the metagenerationMatch option: blob.update(newInfo, BlobTargetOption.metagenerationMatch()).

        Original metadata are merged with metadata in the provided blobInfo. To replace metadata instead you first have to unset them. Unsetting metadata can be done by setting the provided blobInfo's metadata to null.

        Example usage of replacing blob's metadata: 

             blob.update(blob.info().toBuilder().metadata(null).build());
     blob.update(blob.info().toBuilder().metadata(newMetadata).build());
        Parameters:
        blobInfo - new blob's information. Bucket and blob names must match the current ones
        options - update options
        Returns:
        a Blob object with updated information
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • delete

        public boolean delete(Blob.BlobSourceOption... options)
        Deletes this blob.
        Parameters:
        options - blob delete options
        Returns:
        true if blob was deleted, false if it was not found
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • copyTo

        public CopyWriter copyTo(BlobId targetBlob,
                         Blob.BlobSourceOption... options)
        Sends a copy request for the current blob to the target blob. Possibly also some of the metadata are copied (e.g. content-type).
        Parameters:
        targetBlob - target blob's id
        options - source blob options
        Returns:
        a CopyWriter object that can be used to get information on the newly created blob or to complete the copy if more than one RPC request is needed
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • copyTo

        public CopyWriter copyTo(String targetBucket,
                         Blob.BlobSourceOption... options)
        Sends a copy request for the current blob to the target bucket, preserving its name. Possibly copying also some of the metadata (e.g. content-type).
        Parameters:
        targetBucket - target bucket's name
        options - source blob options
        Returns:
        a CopyWriter object that can be used to get information on the newly created blob or to complete the copy if more than one RPC request is needed
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • copyTo

        public CopyWriter copyTo(String targetBucket,
                         String targetBlob,
                         Blob.BlobSourceOption... options)
        Sends a copy request for the current blob to the target blob. Possibly also some of the metadata are copied (e.g. content-type).
        Parameters:
        targetBucket - target bucket's name
        targetBlob - target blob's name
        options - source blob options
        Returns:
        a CopyWriter object that can be used to get information on the newly created blob or to complete the copy if more than one RPC request is needed
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • reader

        Parameters:
        options - blob read options
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • writer

        public WriteChannel writer(Storage.BlobWriteOption... options)
        Returns a WriteChannel object for writing to this blob. By default any md5 and crc32c values in the current blob are ignored unless requested via the BlobWriteOption.md5Match and BlobWriteOption.crc32cMatch options.
        Parameters:
        options - target blob options
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • signUrl

        public URL signUrl(long duration,
                   TimeUnit unit,
                   Storage.SignUrlOption... options)
        Generates a signed URL for this blob. If you want to allow access to for a fixed amount of time for this blob, you can use this method to generate a URL that is only valid within a certain time period. This is particularly useful if you don't want publicly accessible blobs, but don't want to require users to explicitly log in.
        Parameters:
        duration - time until the signed URL expires, expressed in unit. The finer granularity supported is 1 second, finer granularities will be truncated
        unit - time unit of the duration parameter
        options - optional URL signing options
        Returns:
        a signed URL for this bucket and the specified options
        See Also:
        Signed-URLs

      • storage

        public Storage storage()
        Returns the blob's Storage object used to issue requests.

      • get

        public static List<Blob> get(Storage storage,
                             BlobId first,
                             BlobId second,
                             BlobId... other)
        Gets the requested blobs. A batch request is used to fetch blobs.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used to issue the request
        first - the first blob to get
        second - the second blob to get
        other - other blobs to get
        Returns:
        an immutable list of Blob objects. If a blob does not exist or access to it has been denied the corresponding item in the list is null
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • get

        public static List<Blob> get(Storage storage,
                             List<BlobId> blobs)
        Gets the requested blobs. A batch request is used to fetch blobs.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used to issue the request
        blobs - list of blobs to get
        Returns:
        an immutable list of Blob objects. If a blob does not exist or access to it has been denied the corresponding item in the list is null
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • update

        public static List<Blob> update(Storage storage,
                                BlobInfo... infos)
        Updates the requested blobs. A batch request is used to update blobs. Original metadata are merged with metadata in the provided BlobInfo objects. To replace metadata instead you first have to unset them. Unsetting metadata can be done by setting the provided BlobInfo objects metadata to null. See update(com.google.gcloud.storage.BlobInfo, com.google.gcloud.storage.Storage.BlobTargetOption...) for a code example.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used to issue the request
        infos - the blobs to update
        Returns:
        an immutable list of Blob objects. If a blob does not exist or access to it has been denied the corresponding item in the list is null
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure

      • delete

        public static List<Boolean> delete(Storage storage,
                                   BlobId... blobs)
        Deletes the requested blobs. A batch request is used to delete blobs.
        Parameters:
        storage - the storage service used to issue the request
        blobs - the blobs to delete
        Returns:
        an immutable list of booleans. If a blob has been deleted the corresponding item in the list is true. If a blob was not found, deletion failed or access to the resource was denied the corresponding item is false
        Throws:
        StorageException - upon failure
